meanings.definition: Resembling chalk in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The rock had a chalklike feel to it.
meanings.sent2: Her skin was so pale, it looked chalklike.
meanings.sent3: The cat left chalklike paw prints all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: The clouds had a chalklike color as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a chalklike pencil to sketch the landscape.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of chalk.
meanings.sent1: The old house had a chalklike smell of dampness.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's voice had a chalklike dryness to it.
meanings.sent3: The chalklike taste of the medicine made him cringe.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a chalklike stiffness from too much hairspray.
meanings.sent5: The chalklike dust settled on the furniture after erasing the board.
